website_summaries.verdict: A unique camera microphone option most suited for interviews or personal recordings.
pros: Small clip-on design mounts discretely on a single individual
Does a good job of picking up speech in loud or outdoor settings
Convenient to store and carry around
cons: Microphone can be difficult to use when connected to a camera

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, and the USB adapter is included all for less than just the GoPro adapter itself if you buy the GoPro brand one. Please watch my video review and audio test
customer_reviews.author: Mediahound 🎧

customer_reviews.title: Great little lavalier mic. Worth the price tag! Watch my review video
customer_reviews.text: Just what i needed, a compact lavalier microphone that compensates for GoPro's ridiculously low internal mic. Great little mic with big sound difference. Watch my video review and watch me unboxing it and putting it to the test. It was delivered all the way to the Middle East within 5 days from date of purchase and i am very happy with the speed of shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Talla

customer_reviews.title: Works great for GoPro hero 4
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my GoPro hero 4 silver to record audio inside my helmet while I motovlog. It works great for me.. clear voice and not too much wind noise. I do wish the windscreen was a bit thicker, so I could open some vents but for the money it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Jones

customer_reviews.title: super 'hot' mic! way too loud!
customer_reviews.text: purchased this mic along with the gopro adapter for my gopro hero5 session. the mic was extremely 'hot', i experimented with placing it almost near my waist and it was still very loud. once i get to chest level, it was actually a bit distorted, even at fairly normal speaking levels (certainly not yelling). i returned this item and i am still in the game for something that sounds better than this. i gave it 3 stars because if you were using it with something besides a gopro where you had a mixer or a way to control the level, it would work fine.
customer_reviews.author: satan165

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: For $15 you can't beat this! I hate the built in GoPro microphone - the audio is soft and easily pics up all the smallest bumps and shakes of the camera, which has ruined my commentary in many of my videos over the years. Not sure why I waited this long to do something about it, but I'm glad I did! The audio quality on the mic is great, much much better than the GoPro built-in mic. See my video review for more info. Also on YouTube at "Wanderlust Valkyrie" :D
customer_reviews.author: Sera Ronsdóttir

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive product
customer_reviews.text: My wife has started doing videos for a popular internet platform and we found the internal mic in the GoPro Hero 3 to be rather lacking in both loudness and overall sound quality. This mic is not only a good deal louder but has much better clarity. It is a breeze to use, simply plug in and go. I'm well satisfied for the price! BTW the reviews seem to vary as to the cord length, mine is about 4 feet overall so its adequate for personal filming.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Stover

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these microphones and the micro USB adapter does not fit anything that I own, although it is the same and exact fit for what I had bought it for they are not made correctly, so I bought aftermarket adapters that do fit and these microphones do not work at all completely a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Daniel nahodil

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for 🤷🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this lapel mic. No matter what I have connected to, it isn’t registered and/or doesn’t pick up anything. You can hear crackling where it is trying, but nothing to where it can be useful. The instructions that came with it clearly show a 3 pole plug, but what I received only has 2. Maybe that’s the issue? But I don’t have the time or patience to fiddle with this any more. It came with everything else it said it would. Unfortunately I will be returning it and finding a different option.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price, awesome quality!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome price, awesome quality! Tough to beat! This is said to work for almost every phone if anyone shall want to use it as a pocket recorder, however when it comes to iPhones, it requires an adaptor that splits Audio and Mic (into Female input and three-stripe Aux Male output, which connects to the iPhones' separate adapter. So yeah, it uses 2 adapters because the iPhone doesn't have an Aux input).
customer_reviews.author: LOUI5

customer_reviews.title: like this one
customer_reviews.text: If you want to use a lavalier mic with a GoPro 5 or 6 you'll need their adaptor and a three channel mic... like this one. I bought two four channel mics (count how many segments are in the plug end) and they don't work. I'm more than pleased with the performance. Just figure out a way to secure the dead cat because it falls off pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Wadkins

customer_reviews.title: Good Microphone, but foam windscreen is not sufficient
customer_reviews.text: This microphone works well as far as picking up sound, but the foam windscreen supplied is poor quality and allows a lot of wind noise into the microphone. Replace the foam windscreen with one of higher density, and you will be satisfied with this microphone.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: Well I had bought these for my new Akaso (camera) and I had even typed the model and it said they worked However the plug and adapter are incorrect so I decided to let my 12 year old nephew try the nic with his camera and BAM it worked lovely he is very happy which makes me happy. so thanks team. They are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Nathan paul

customer_reviews.title: Great value mic for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall this product works well for my gopro. The sound is a stepup towards the regular gopro alone. I wish the cord wasnt too long but overall im happy with it. I still haven’t tested it for windnoise but im happy i got this one as it makes my fishing commentary more clear!
customer_reviews.author: bwong247

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: These things work great with my after market action cams, they allow me to use external mics, but the action cams can't pick up sound from much of a distant, even with an external mic. But I will use these with my new vlog camera for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Onemanwo1fpackz

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound, but needs improvements.
customer_reviews.text: Sound isn't bad, it's actually fairly clean. My 2 biggest gripes are 1. The cable could be MUCH longer. It's extremely short, and for this reason alone I'll be buying another brand mic. 2. The cable itself is flimsy and not of that great of quality. Overall, it gets the job done, depending on what you plan on using it for and what type of stress you'll be putting the mic thru. However, don't expect this to last a real long time. I'd say lifespan is "maybe" a year, at best.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: This is the best inexpensive microphone package for your GoPro
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these microphones and I would highly recommend them. I have a GoPro Hero3 white edition camera, and after numerous searches through reviews, I chose the GM100 for two factors: 1. The price. You can't beat the price for this microphone especially when it comes with the mic adapter included. 2. The reviews. This microphone was the perfect addition. It picks up clear audio, whether wearing it as a traditional lav, or attaching it to your GoPro housing. If you're looking for an inexpensive YET worth more in quality, I highly recommend The Movo GM100.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kelly (Sam T Wasteaway)

customer_reviews.title: This external mic make the sound worse. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bough this external mic and side open housing case. I noticed the sound improvement from the gopro with the water proof housing case as I did before. I was very happy with my purchase momentarily. But one day I forgot to bring the external mic with me, and recorded my video (same situation) with the gopro in the side open hosing case without the external mic. The sound is better than the external mic, there is much less noise. Don't waste your money on this external mic, just buy a side open housing case and you will improve your gopro sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Night and day difference!
customer_reviews.text: I use my Hero 3 to record my kayak fishing adventures. Even in a frame mount, the audio for this application was mostly unusable. Then this product entered my life. The difference in sound quality is astounding. Now I can hear the birds chirping, the line screaming from my reels on casts, and water splashing when fighting fish. Normal talking shows up perfectly. I don't even wear the mic as a lapel mic, but clip it to the USB adapter plugged into the Hero 3. AMAZING PRODUCT and worth every penny and more.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P. Young

customer_reviews.title: Mic pops with winds over 50mph but overall excellent mic for price.
customer_reviews.text: The mic is great. I been using it in my LS2 omega stream helmet for months now. However, when you exceed 40-50 mph the mic - EVEN WITH THE WINDOW PROTECTOR - starts popping. Works great as a recording mic for low speed action, but not worth taking in your car or motorcycle. The popping isn't terrible so if you want to bear with it you can, but fir motovlogging, this is not your mic. For the price, very much worth it. Sound Quality 9/10 Wind Resistance 5/10
customer_reviews.author: Desmond

customer_reviews.title: Great gopro accessory.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mic for use in my helmet, while riding at highway speeds. This mic works well. The sound is crisp (far better than the microphone that's built into the gopro) and it pics my voice up just fine while on the move. The sound of the engine comes through loud and clear, without MOST of the wind noise that the gopro microphone picks up. My only gripe with these types of microphones, is the long cable. Since I'm mounting the gopro and mic in my helmet, I'd love to have the option to have a cable that's only a few inches long.
customer_reviews.author: Jason #CVMA286

customer_reviews.title: Used with GoPro hero4 black.
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: The mic is being used in my motorcycle helmet with a GoPro Hero 4 Black. The mic works well, indoors. Once it's got any real noise going through it such as motorcycle engine noise, wind noise, etc., it pops and crackles constantly. I doubled the windscreen and even taped over it, but the popping and crackling continued.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GoPro Hero 4
customer_reviews.text: I tried multiple lavalier microphones starting with the Amazon Basics, then the purple panda. None of them worked for some reason, but THIS movo lav mic worked perfect and had no issues. Its priced great, and sounds pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money

customer_reviews.title: the camera does pick up the mic audio and it sounds MUCH better than the gopro mic quality

I found a little DIY article walking through the step require to make an adapter that will work. after doing that, the camera does pick up the mic audio and it sounds MUCH better than the gopro mic quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cerid Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This item is great! I do YouTube videos and the quality is very good! The only issue is that the cord might be too long. I use this on a chest cam mount and i need to wrap it around the base.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Pennell

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking & buy this microphone!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't even waste another second looking for an external mic for your GoPro. I have the 3+ and just received this GM100 lapel mic today. I am just BLOWN AWAY by how GREAT it sounds. I took the GoPro out of the waterproof housing and made two videos. 1 just using the internal mic, and one using this mic, and it is mind blowing the sound difference this mic produces. It's LOUD & crystal CLEAR. To say it's twice ad good as as the cameras built in mic is an understatement. I promise if you get this one you will be soooooooo glad you read my review!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Royal

customer_reviews.title: Buy an extension cable or the upgraded model.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars, but the length of the cable is detrimental. If you are taking selfies at arm's length, it is the right size. Any further away and you will need an extension cable. The quality is leaps and bounds better than the internal mic on the GoPro cameras. I've used it for an interview, and had to buy a separate extension cable to get a reasonable 5 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: JustinKY

customer_reviews.title: works with only the gopro
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in the mail. I've tried it out with the gopro and it works fine but I wanted to use it with other cameras and it acts as headphones and uses the devices microphone. I guess it's advertised like that But I was a bit disappointed. Cord length is short but I didn't really care about that. It dos in fact use with my game capture card but other than that not much. The Dampener falls off easily but the quality is still really good.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Go pro mic
customer_reviews.text: I wired this into my motorcycle helmet to plug into my go pro to record audio when I drive. The foam on the mic blocks out most of the wind and the audio is great. Dont bother getting a fancy expensive brand name mic, this one works great.
customer_reviews.author: Emerson Winter

customer_reviews.title: a must for GOpro 3black +
customer_reviews.text: Sounds WAY better than the cameras microphone. if you are trying to get a microphone for your gopro 3 without breaking the bank this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Anna A

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install (you may have to make a hole in the GoPro Mount). I used it to avoid wind noise on a motorcycle video. It worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: kim DiDonato-Murrell

customer_reviews.title: Good mic for motovlog
customer_reviews.text: I use this mic on my motorcycle helmet. For better sound quality/less wind noise, take a clean sock, cut a piece and wrap it around the mic, then duck tape it. Greatly Reduces wind noise!
customer_reviews.author: Youniverse (Shark Diver)

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended

customer_reviews.title: Nice Microphone! A must have for the GO PRO!

I wanted this for vlogging and to be able to record myself and be able to have clear audio. The GoPro audio isn't terrible but it can really kill a video. I looked at several other microphones but I ended up buying this one. I would highly reccomend it, if your looking to purchase one exclusively for the GoPro
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Voss

customer_reviews.title: GoPro adapter does not work!

customer_reviews.author: Isaiah R. Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: It plugged into my GoPro Hero 3+ perfectly. The ...
customer_reviews.text: It plugged into my GoPro Hero 3+ perfectly. The little foam ball vanished on the first ride so I made a new one that fit more snug. It doesn't matter where I hide the mic. Inside my 3/4 helmet, up under my chin strap, under the face guard of my full face helmet, it picks up wind noise after about 30 mph and all of the other mechanical noises my motorcycles make. I'm really hoping this is my lack of video experience. I'll keep trying. I may end up making some type of cup to wrap around the foam ball to block some wind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Hero 7 Black
customer_reviews.text: Tried every setting combination available. Tried 3 wind filters (all at the same time on top of each other) and at 30 mph is just blares the sound like crazy. Unusable with MOTO vlogging.

customer_reviews.title: Cable works, lav doesn't! Can't contact seller
customer_reviews.text: The lav Mic didn't work at all and their is no way to follow up with The company to complain. No link to send seller a note. But the connection cable to the go pro does work. When i used one of my own lavs. Just the pur chase was with lab combined so 1 star.

Sound is clear and loud, & my friends all agree with me.

customer_reviews.text: I have to return this because the camera I bought it for is no good. Thankfully this item is returnable, therefore I'll give you five stars!

customer_reviews.title: No static/frequency noises on GoPro Hero 4 Silver!
customer_reviews.text: After trying several mic adapter/lapel mic kits with my GoPro Hero4 Silver with LCD screen, this is the one to go with. I purchased 3 others, ranging from high end to cheap and ALL of them picked up a high pitch static sound during play back (wifi off). So before resorting to just editing the audio every time, I tried this one as a last attempt. WORKS GREAT!! No static, no interference at all! Get a better wind sock if you're using it in a motorcycle helmet but definitely get this kit if you're having audio issues with other lapel mic/adapter kits for your GoPro Hero 4 silver.

I'm sure there's a way, I just didn't find it yet.
